result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius B. Marion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Demetrius B. Marion

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Bond on file applied to court costs.    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Contact with the victim to be determined by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete anger management or domestic violence programming, if agent recommends.  

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.  

Credit for 4 days, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Satorius.  Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections noted.  State recommended: 90-120  days jail.  Defense recommended:  60 days jail.  Court ordered: 120 days jail.  Credit for 60 days.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
sent ROAW to Judge electronically this date.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.
from DOC
DNA submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Wilson.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead no contest to DC, domestic, repeater.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Repeater allegation confirmed.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1 as charged.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Anger management or DV programming, if agent recommends.  Defense requesting 8 months probation.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation. Concurrent with any probation now serving.   Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to random testing by his agent.  Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without prior approval.  Contact with the victim left for agent to determine. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Anger management or DV programming, if agent recommends.  CC, Domestic and DNA surcharges.  Credit for 4 days.

Demetrius called @ 9:45am to say he couldn't make it for court today, I suggested he contact his attorney David Wilson, Demetrius then said he could try and make it to court although he was in Independence at the time. I saw Attorney Wilson in the hallway and informed him of the conversation.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 10:00 am
Status conference at 02-22-2016 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss for Attorney Wilson.  One more STC set for 2/22/16 at 3 pm.  Defendant to keep in contact with Attorney Wilson.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:M. M.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant appears by video from JASO.  ADA Inlow appears for the State.  States he has received the complaint.  Judge reviews the charges/potential penalties.  He understands.  Court explains his attorney options.  State requests a sig bond with conditions.  Defendant tells the Court he will live with a relative if he can't live at the residence on the complaint.  Court orders a $250 sig bond with conditions and sets AIA for 11-30-15 at 9:30.  Should still send mail to the address in the case.  He is to notify the Clerk of Court if his mailing address changes.
